intro: Thrincia tripolitana, commonly known as the Tripolitana thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a spherical capsule that contains several seeds. Thrincia tripolitana is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions.
